how would you describe your main use cas: As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: Yes, and I am the only editor/administrator of my wiki(s)
putting it all together, what value does: I am in the process of building a historical knowledge base for myself and I chose TW because it's future-proof and it will be very easy to publish once I will be done.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I am comfortable writing filter expressions
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki third-party mobile app (e.g. Tiddloid, Quine)
we would love to know what your basic se:
I don't know how to do this on Android. These are the main plugins I use:
- Notebook theme
- Autocomplete
- Relink
- Context Menu
- Shiraz
- Muuri
- Command Palette
- Locator
- Freelinks
- Tiddler Commander
outside of plugins, palettes and other i: Yes, but they are small modifications and they are AI generated. I don't have enough technical knowledge.
what are we doing well? prompts for thin: Maintaining backwards compatibility for such a long time is definitely something to applaud. The HTML format is also a big plus. The main reason I am using TW for my project is knowing that even in the distant future I will be able to open it and my work won't be lost.
what could we do better? prompts for thi:
Tiddlywiki is just too difficult to use for non-technical people like me. For my personal notes I am using Obsidian simply because it's easier to use.

Non-text files are difficult to work with. Setting up a Github saver with Canonical URI or something similar takes days for someone like me.

It would also be helpful if filters could be built using a UI. 

Compared to Obsidian or Notion, TW's user base is small, and I'm not too confident that TW will be able to complete in the long term.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
